cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 430 mi SW of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast across the Gulf of Mexico, expected to cross the Florida Panhandle/Big Bend area and then accelerate NE across the southeastern U.S. before emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: none in Mid-Atlantic; tropical-storm and storm-surge watches limited to Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning: Mississippi/Alabama border to Yankeetown, FL and Grand Isle, LA to Mouth of Pearl River; Storm-surge warning: Indian Pass, FL to Clearwater Beach, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast, Florida Peninsula, coastal GA/SC/NC and offshore Mid-Atlantic waters
weather_observation.wind: Breezy to windy conditions possible Monday with gusts generally below 39 mph
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain Monday into early Tuesday, generally 1–2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough bay/near-shore seas and minor tidal flooding possible in the Chesapeake Bay
